batch.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: a group of people or things that arrive or are dealt with together
batch.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: Every day another batch of papers reaches the manager, demanding his attention.
batch.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: a quantity of food, medicine etc that is produced or prepared at the same time
batch.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: She was in the kitchen taking a batch of bread out of the oven.
batch.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: a set of jobs that are dealt with together on a computer
batch.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: a group of similar things or people arriving or being dealt with at the same time
batch.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: the process of indexing each new batch of documents
batch.translation[1].definitions[1].defi: a quantity of food, goods, work etc prepared or produced at the same time
batch.translation[1].definitions[1].exam: The paper is always from a single batch, to ensure evenness of shade.
